circumstances: On approach to Allentown-Bethlehem Easton Airport, the crew encountered limited visibility due to foggy conditions and low ceiling. The twin engine aircraft descended below the glide, struck trees and crashed in a wooded area located in Slatington, about 10,5 miles short of runway 13 threshold. The aircraft was destroyed and both occupants were injured.
probable_cause:
Collision with trees during initial approach due to improper IFR operation. The following contributing factors were reported:
- Low ceiling, 
- Fog,
- Visibility two miles or less.
